locale.name: en_US
locale.message: This file archive includes parsed and converted NLM-XML, HTML, and PDF copies of your article. It also contains any accompanying images, and structured citation data in BibTeX format (for importing into reference databases such as Zotero or Mendeley).
Document Markup Server. Status: RECEIVED FROM SERVER.
Document Markup Plugin needs to be enabled.
Supplementary file is already a zip archive.
You need to login to access this file.
You are not allowed to access this file.
Request must be linked to a journal.
You have not specified a markup server address (default should be http://pkp-udev.lib.sfu.ca).
PKP Open Journal Systems Document Markup Plugin
Although a "Document Markup Files" supplementary record exists, its file is missing.
Article or its "Document Markup Files" supplementary file RECORD is missing. Try re-uploading the article to regenerate the markup files.

When an author, copyeditor or editor uploads a new version (DOC/DOCX/ODT format) of an article, this module submits it to the document markup server specified in the settings. It then receives parsed and formatted XML, HTML, EPUB and PDF galleys of the article.
Unable to fetch article XML and HTML versions. The Document Markup plugin needs to be enabled and the citation style needs to be provided in Journal Settings.
Toggle for review version is optional.
Specify whether existing documents must be overwritten.
At least one document format must be selected.
Invalid Document Markup Server! Please specifiy correct URL.
Set preferred citation style for markup.
This CSS stylesheet affects the layout of articles generated by this plugin. Default styles are automatically provided. You may replace these with your own customized versions using the file manager
PHP curl needs to be installed on your server. This plugin uses curl to send the article files to the Document Markup Server service for processing.
A user ID is required to use the conversion service. You can obtain one for free at PKP Document Markup Service.
The journal will retrieve converted documents from this server URL. Normally you should not change this setting.
"Enabled" is the default selection if supported by your server. If set to "Disabled," images may be missing from HTML version of articles.
PHP zlib needs to be installed on your OJS server. This plugin uses zlib to unzip the Document Markup Server files.
Whether existing documents in galley must be overridden or not on new layout upload.
Your document has been successfuly submitted to document markup server. Transformation progress is available at: {$url}
Unable to submit your document to document markup server. Please make sure the plugin is correctly installed and configured.
